figure_1.title: FIGURE 1.
figure_1.caption: The cyclical consistency of the CycleGAN. This figure visually demonstrates the 3T cycle consistency. The 7T loop is conceptually symmetric. The generators are marked as performing the mappings  and . The Real 3T image is fed to the  (top left), producing the synthetic 7T image (top middle). The  discriminator differentiates between the Real and Synthetic 7T images and strives to minimize 7T adversarial loss (bottom left). The synthetic 7T image is fed into the  generator, which produces the reconstructed 3T image. The 3T cycle consistency loss ensures the 3T image can be reconstructed from the synthetic 7T image (top right).

figure_2.title: FIGURE 2.
figure_2.caption: Progression of CycleGAN training dynamics and quality metrics for 3T to 7T MRI translation. (a) Generator, Discriminator and Cycle Consistency Losses for the 3T loop, (b) Generator, Discriminator, and Cycle Consistency Losses for the 7T loop, (c) Fréchet ResNet Distance (FRD), (d) Cosine Resnet Distance (CRD). The graphs illustrate the evolution of loss functions and quality metrics over training epochs. The vertical black dotted line mark epoch 167, where we halted training since we did not observe an improvement bigger than 0.1% in the 3T cycle consistency loss for five consecutive epochs.

figure_3.title: FIGURE 3.
figure_3.caption: Examples of real 7T MR images (left column) and the corresponding synthetic 7T images (right column) generated by our model.

figure_4.title: FIGURE 4.
figure_4.caption: Group-level segmentation performance for the validation (22 subjects) data set across different tissue types—Cerebral Spinal Fluid (CSF), Gray Matter (GM), and White Matter (WM). We plot single patient data overlaid on group-level whisker box plots (center, median; box, 25th to 75th percentiles; whiskers, 1.5 interquartile range) and the smoothed data distribution. The median Dice for CSD, GM and WM are 83.62%, 81.42%, and 89.75%, respectively. The median percentual area difference (PAD) for CSF, GM, and WM are 6.82%, 7.63%, and 4.85%, respectively.

claims.sentence: Figure 1 shows a schematic representation of the architecture and functioning of the CycleGAN model.

In general, Figure 2 shows that the embedded MRI captures more relevant features in the data, with the measures of transformation quality showing a consistent and smooth decrease throughout the training process.3.2 |.
Figure 3 shows examples of real and synthetic 7T MRI image pairs generated by our model.
The results, visualized using box plots (Figure 4), revealed that the model achieved a median Dice of 83.62% for CSF, 81.42% for GM and 89.75% for WM.
